question: Harivijaya was the work of which of the following Vakataka ruler?
explanation: Sarvasena (c. 330 â€“ 355 CE) who adopted the title dharma-maharaja was believed to be a renowned Prakrit poet, and his lost work, the Harivijaya, was praised by later writers. Some of the verses of Sarvasena were incorporated into the Gathasattasai.
